page.title: 07"Metheringham Fire Station"
page.content: The Fire Station is on the corner of Fen Road and the new by pass. They have one fire engine and twelve firemen. The Fire Station was opened in 1947, just after the 2nd.World War. All the firemen have to have a "bleeper"to warn them when there is a fire because they all have other jobs as well. They receive a "retaining" fee and a call out fee. They practise on Monday nights, for two hours,except for Bank Holidays when it is changed to Wednesday.They get between 70 to 80 fires a year. They also go to road traffic accidents, pump out flooded buildings,put out stubble fires which have got out of control and rescue people and animals who are in difficulty.
